greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of shapes of balanced k-ary trees with n nodes, where a tree is balanced if the total number of nodes in subtrees corresponding to the branches of any node differ by at most one; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
Samuele Giraudo, Intervals of balanced binary trees in the Tamari lattice, arXiv:1107.3472 [math.CO], Apr 2012
example: :   o     o   :   o    o    o   :   o      o      o   :
: o         o : o      o      o : o o    o   o    o o :
:    o        o        o        o       o        o    :
: o o      o   o    o     o    o o     o   o      o o :
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; local m, r; if n<2 or k=1 then 1
elif k=0 then 0 else r:= iquo(n-1, k, 'm');
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = Module[{m, r}, If[n < 2 || k == 1, 1, If[k == 0, 0, {r, m} = QuotientRemainder[n-1, k]; Binomial[k, m]*a[r+1, k]^m*a[r, k]^(k-m)]]]; Table[a[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 17 2013, translated from Maple *)
xref: Lower diagonals give: A000012, A000290, A092364(n) for n>1.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 10 2013
